abstract.text: Broadcast your playlist, mix, or voice to the world.

inlineContent.text: SocialRadio is a framework that provides an interactive user interface for AutomixIQ. It allows users to start a broadcast using music from your catalog, voice, and other content. Users can also join existing broadcasts, interact with other community members or the broadcaster, and more.
AutomixIQ is integrated into the framework to support SocialRadio, but it can also operate as a standalone product.

This documentation provides a step-by-step guide for integrating SocialRadio into your application, using either Tuned Global’s catalog or your own. It also outlines how to leverage Tuned Global’s existing backend for social layer operations, or alternatively, how to implement your own custom backend.

AutomixIQPlaybackEventType is an enum of all the available playback events
TunedPluginMetadataModel models metadata of a track traditionally obtained by running plugins on it. Key and BPM are recommented for best mixing.
The Type entry for bpm and key are “key” and “bpm” (case sensitive) respectively, the values need to be formatted as strings, and the key needs to be in OpenKey format.

SocialRadioStatus models the State of the AutomixIQ during playback.
Tools to interact with the social layer.
SocialLayerDelegates is an object that holds all delegates used to communicate between the SocialRadio SDK and a backend that handles storage of social interactions.

‘authenticationDelegate’, ‘userDelegate’ and ‘liveMixtapeDelegate’ are required always. Every other delegate can be nil and is only required if your backend and SocialRadio implementation supports the attached features, like commenting, moderation, backgrounds, etc.
See each delegate’s documentation for details.
